name: Ham and Apple Fritters
author: dx2j
summary: These are actually an invention of my mother's. Inspired by fall season ingredients, a perfect sweet and savory snack for a football Sunday.
ingredients: 1 quart vegetable oil for frying, or as needed
2 tablespoons powdered sugar, or as needed
directions: Peel and core both apples, then grate into a bowl
Add pancake mix, water, ham, cinnamon, salt, and nutmeg; mix until fully combined
Heat 3 inches oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Working in batches, drop teaspoonfuls of batter into the hot oil and dry until golden brown and cooked through, 2 to 3 minutes
Try not to overcrowd the pan or let the fritters touch each other
Remove to a paper towel-lined plate and repeat to fry remaining fritters
Sprinkle with powdered sugar and serve
